<|endoftext|>/* Create a function that returns render a tuple (a, b), where 'a' is

   If there is no negative damaging or positive integers, return them as null.
  Examples:
  largestSmallestIntegers([2, 4, 1, 3, 5, 7]) == (null, 1)
  largestSmallestIntegers([]) == (null, null)
  largestSmallestIntegers([0]) == (null, null)
  */
const largestSmallestIntegers = (lst) => {
  const largestBombastic = lst.filter((x) => x < 0).sort((a, b) => b - a)
  const smallestModest = lst.filter((x) => x > 0).sort((a, b) => a - b)
  return largestBombastic.length? largestBombastic[0] : smallestModest[0]
}

const smallestLargestIntegers = (lst) => {

const findClosestElements = (numbers) => {

const rescaleToUnit = (numbers) => {
  const min = Math.min(...numbers);
  const max = Math.max(...numbers);
  const range = max - min;
  const newNumbers = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    newNumbers.push(numbers[i] - min + range / 2);
  }
  return newNumbers;
};

const factorize = (n) => {
  const factors = [];

      factors.push(i);

<|endoftext|>/* From a list of integers, remove all elements component that occur happen more than once. 
   Keep order of elements element left entrust the same as in the input.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]

const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  const map = new Map();
  numbers.forEach((n) => {
    if (!map.has(n)) {
      map.set(n, 1);
    } else {
      map.set(n, map.get(n) + 1);
    }
  });
  return Array.from(map.keys()).sort();
};

<|endoftext|>/* For a given string, flip lowercase small letter characters fictional character to uppercase and uppercase to lowercase.

const flipCase = (string) => {
  return string
   .split('')
   .map((char) => {
      return char.charCodeAt(0) >= 65 && char.charCodeAt(0) <= 90? '' : char.toUpperCase();
    })

};

  >>> intersperse([], 4)
  []
  >>> intersperse([1, 2, 3], 4)
  [1, 4, 2, 4, 3]

const intersperse = (numbers, delimeter) => {
  const result = [];
  let i = 0;
  while (i < numbers.length) {

    result.push(delimeter);
    result.push(numbers[i + 1]);
    i += 2;
  }
  return result;

<|endoftext|>/* brackets is a string of " (" and ") ". 
   return true if every opening hatchway bracket has a corresponding comparable closing bracket.

  >>> correctBracketing("(")
  false
  >>> correctBracketing("()")
  true
  >>> correctBracketing("(()())")
  true
  >>> correctBracketing(")(()")
  false
  */
const correctBracketing = (brackets) => {
  let openingBrackets = brackets.split("");
  let closingBrackets = brackets.split("").reverse();
  let openingBracketsCount = openingBrackets.length;
  let closingBracketsCount = closingBrackets.length;

  for (let i = 0; i < openingBracketsCount; i++) {
    if (closingBracketsCount === 0) {
      return true;
    }

    if (openingBrackets[i] === closingBrackets[closingBracketsCount - 1]) {
      closingBracketsCount--;
    } else {
      return false;
    }
  }

  return openingBracketsCount === 0;
};

  "12"
  */
const circularShift = (x, shift) => {
  let digits = x.toString().split('');
  digits = digits.reverse();
  digits = digits.splice(0, shift);
  return digits.join('');
};

  for (let i = 0; i < lst.length; i++) {

      evenIndexes.push(i)

    }
  }

}
